Draft Rating:

D

Pete Babcock ranks in the 29th percentile for drafting among executives in our database. Babcock's draft picks average out to be worth the equivalent of 7 spots lower than they were picked due to their terrible drafting.
Some of their biggest wins:
  • Drafted Jason Terry with 10th pick but was worth 6th pick.
  • Drafted Trevor Wilson with 36th pick but was worth 21th pick.
  • Drafted Rodney Monroe with 30th pick but was worth 15th pick.
Some of their biggest busts:
  • Drafted Alan Henderson with 16th pick but was worth 44th pick.
  • Drafted Adam Keefe with 10th pick but was worth 38th pick.
  • Drafted Todd Lichti with 15th pick but was worth 39th pick.

Trade Rating:

B-

Pete Babcock ranks in the 66th percentile for trading among executives in our database.
Their biggest win:
  • Added Mookie Blaylock, Roy Hinson to ATL.
  • Lost Rumeal Robinson to NJN.
Their biggest L:
  • Added Maurice Cheeks to ATL.
  • Lost Tim McCormick, Charlie Ward to NYK.

Signing Rating:

D-

Pete Babcock ranks in the 20th percentile for free agency signings among executives in our database.
Their best signings:
  • Signed Dikembe Mutombo in 1996.
  • Signed Craig Ehlo in 1993.
  • Signed Grant Long in 1999.
Their worst signings:
  • Signed Andrew Lang in 1993.
  • Signed Jacque Vaughn in 2001.
  • Signed Duane Ferrell in 1990.
